item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, December 6, 2024 at 7:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Every UUID Dot Com (140 points | 54 comments)
2. OpenAI Reinforcement Fine-Tuning Research Program (13 points | 1 comment)
3. Install postmarketOS on Android phone and use Docker as a home server (157 points | 63 comments)
4. Tokyo is set to introduce a four-day workweek for government employees (151 points | 82 comments)
5. Romanian court annuls result of presidential election first round (159 points | 250 comments)
6. The Unplanned Impact of Mathematics (2011) (56 points | 19 comments)
7. Llama-3.3-70B-Instruct (164 points | 60 comments)
8. The dogs of Chernobyl: Insights into populations in the nuclear exclusion zone (39 points | 2 comments)
9. Show HN: BunkerWeb – The Open-Source Web Application Firewall (WAF) (81 points | 22 comments)
10. Rivian is opening its charging network to other EVs (56 points | 46 comments)
11. TikTok divestment law upheld by federal appeals court (153 points | 175 comments)
12. Show HN: Real-Time YOLO Object Detection in Elixir: Fast, Simple, Extensible (17 points | discuss)
13. Vanir: Open-Source Security Search and Patch Validation Tool (10 points | discuss)
14. Show HN: Hacker Herald – like HN but with crowdsourced pics and subtitles (154 points | 60 comments)
15. Show HN: Prompt Engine – Auto pick LLMs based on your prompts (69 points | 12 comments)
16. Debian opens a can of username worms (123 points | 150 comments)
17. 'Maya blue': The mystery dye recreated two centuries after it was lost (4 points | 1 comment)
18. RNA-targeting CRISPR reveals that noncoding RNAs are not 'junk' (66 points | 32 comments)
19. RankScience (YC W17) is hiring to supercharge SEO for startups ( | hide)
20. Trailbase: Fast, single-file, open-source app server built using Rust and SQLite (271 points | 89 comments)
21. ExxonMobil's Alleged Hack-for-Hire Campaign Targeting Climate Activists (200 points | 45 comments)
22. Sensible SQLite Defaults (77 points | 33 comments)
23. Constraints Are Good: Python's Metadata Dilemma (47 points | 13 comments)
24. Forensic linguists use grammar, syntax and vocabulary to help crack cold cases (42 points | 30 comments)
25. Reverse engineering the Ravensburger TipToi pen (82 points | 42 comments)
26. New Box64 v0.3.2 and Box86 v0.3.8 released (Native Flags, Benchmarks, Box32) (27 points | 10 comments)
27. Contradictions in photography advice (43 points | 46 comments)
28. Portland airport grows with expansive mass timber roof canopy (379 points | 235 comments)
29. Intel’s board, and an example of when boards and short-termism fail (321 points | 232 comments)
30. Wrote a custom libc for POSIX and x86-64 (8 points | 2 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, December 6, 2024 at 7:15 PM UTC
